title: Aaron Swartz
synopsis: Aaron Swartz (November 8, 1986 – January 11, 2013) was an American computer programmer, entrepreneur, writer, political organizer, and Internet hacktivist - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aaron_Swartz wikipedia]

title: Changes to the Commons
synopsis: Here we list all the [[Commons Sites]] we know of in the federation that concentrate mainly on the commons.

title: Changes to this Site
synopsis: Below we list recent changes to this site only without also listing changes from the [[Neighbourhood]]:

title: Common People
synopsis: Here we write about the [[Common People]], that is people who have in one way or other substantially added to the [[commons]], or are writing here together.

title: Creative Commons
synopsis: Creative Commons (CC) is an American non-profit organization devoted to expanding the range of creative works available for others to build upon legally and to share. The organization has released several copyright-licenses known as Creative Commons licenses free of charge to the public - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creative_Commons wikipedia]

title: Currently Working On
synopsis: Here is a list of [[Recent Changes]] I consider important. View our experiments on the [[Scratch]] page. To clear stuff saved in your browser try [[Local Changes]].

title: Elinor Ostrom
synopsis: Elinor Ostrom (1933 – 2012) was an American political economist whose work was associated with the New Institutional Economics and the resurgence of political economy.

title: Larry Lessig
synopsis: Lester Lawrence "Larry" Lessig III (born June 3, 1961) is an American academic, attorney, and political activist. He is the Roy L. Furman Professor of Law at Harvard Law School and the former director of the Edmond J. Safra Center for Ethics at Harvard University.

title: Lawrence Lessig
synopsis: Lester Lawrence "Larry" Lessig III (born June 3, 1961) is an American academic, attorney, and political activist. He is the Roy L. Furman Professor of Law at Harvard Law School and the former director of the Edmond J. Safra Center for Ethics at Harvard University.

title: Richard Stallman
synopsis: Stallman professes admiration for [[Julian Assange]] and [[Edward Snowden]] - [http://www.livemint.com/Politics/rwwhxWH1sgb1ZdYQycTuWO/Richard-Stallman-surveillance-is-incompatible-with-democrac.html livemint.com] and [http://rt.com/news/nsa-privacy-snowden-stallman-130/ rt.com]

title: Stallman on Intellectual Property
synopsis: Stallman argues that the term "intellectual property" is designed to confuse people, and is used to prevent intelligent discussion on the specifics of [[copyright]], patent, trademark, and other laws by lumping together areas of law that are more dissimilar, than similar.

title: Stallman on Surveillance
synopsis: Stallman professes admiration for [[Julian Assange]] and [[Edward Snowden]] - [http://www.livemint.com/Politics/rwwhxWH1sgb1ZdYQycTuWO/Richard-Stallman-surveillance-is-incompatible-with-democrac.html livemint.com] and [http://rt.com/news/nsa-privacy-snowden-stallman-130/ rt.com]

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Here we write about the [[Common People]], that is people who have in one way or other _substantially added_ to the [[commons]].
